results.title: Tech Talk Episodes 11 & 12.
results.creator_credit: John Kyle, Allenog Pty Ltd and SBS-TV
results.brief_description: A compilation tape containing eight programmes designed to help young people in their career choices. Details of what various jobs entail, the neccessary qualifications and how to go about getting the job are provided. There is also a segment on survival skills. The topics covered are as follows- apprenticeships, photography, carpet laying, gardening, locksmith, travel agent, lift mechanic, despair and how to handle it. Presented by Michael Shildberger.

results.title: Teamwork on the Potomac
results.brief_description: A story about pollution in Potomac River, showing the river at its worst and describing the difficult climb toward restoration. Discusses pollution, sewage-disposal methods, and water management problems. Considers the teamwork necessary to remove the pollution.

results.title: Teams work (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
Even though our education pushes us towards individual achievement, groups and teams are often essential for an organisation to reach its goals. This episode looks at the value of effective teamwork, different approaches to increasing the effectiveness of teams and the task of managers to understand and utilise groups. We look at an ABC news crew team and follow a training day in the bush with National Mutual.

results.title: Team building: How to motivate and manage people. V.3
results.brief_description: Presented by Mark Sanborn, this seminar presentation shows how you can turn your staff into a “can do” team. Part one: “Teamwork pays off” looks at achieving desired bottom line results through teamwork, 21 questions to determine the success of your team amd seven commitments of strong team relationships. Part two: “Developing a team vision” investigates three types of goals you can set for your team, fun group “games” you can play to build you team, team players vs. team slayers, and soliciting valuable input from your team memebrs.

results.title: Team building: How to motivate and manage people. V.2
results.brief_description: Presented by Mark Sanborn, this volume includes as follows; Part one: “Team communication”investigates how the information system can dramatically increase innovation, six essential elements of a powerful team meeting and keys to handle interpersonal conflict. Part two: “Motivate and celebrate” looks at five reasons why people procrastinate, use rewards that really motivate and new ways to celebrate your team’s accomplishments that increase productivity and commitment.

results.title: Team building: How to motivate and manage people. V.1
results.brief_description: Presenter Mark Sanborn identifies, in this seminar presentation, the key qualities of effective teams. Part one: “Teamwork pays” looks at why it is so difficult to build a team, the 10 critical differences between a team and a group, and seven ways to find valuable team members. Part two: “Education and training” looks at the Hologarphic team approach, the four C’s of effective team-work: Commitment, Cooperation, Communication and Contribution, and five proven ideas for training your team.

results.title: Teaching your wings to fly (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Yasha Aginsky, Anne Lief Barlin and Lawren Productions
results.brief_description: Dance instructor Anne Lief Barlin demonstrates how to teach young children 19 movement activities designed to enhance body control, self-esteem, spatial awareness, coordination, relation to others, and relaxation.

results.title: Teaching young children
results.creator_credit: Jane Massy, Dorothy Grayson and Realist Films
results.brief_description: This film deals with infant teaching as a vocation. It is designed for girls between the ages of 16 and 18 years; two girls are introduced, and their two-year course of study at an Infant Teaching Training College in Britain is followed, showing how, both in the college, and in teaching practice, their understanding of children aids them in teaching and at the same time advances and expands their own general education and social consciousness.

results.title: Teaching with sound
results.brief_description: A promotional device outlining the potential for sound films as teaching aids, specifically as aids in scientific visualisation. Of historical interest due to its age and the (then) novelty of its subject.
